Key Match Events: Bobby Witt Jr. added a sacrifice fly to the wall in dead center and an RBI double, marking his first multi-hit game since September 3 against Cleveland and his first game with a walk since the same date. He also had his first multi-RBI game since August 10 against St. Louis.
Pre-Game Insights: The offense had a weird day with seven hits but six going for extra bases. They scored five runs, which is above average in a game, but it felt like they could and should have scored a lot more.
Post-Match Reflections: The Royals clinched their first winning season since 2015 with todayâ€™s victory. They have a chance to sweep tomorrow with Brady Singer pitching against the Pirates.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Michael Wacha allowed the Pirates' sole run over his five innings while striking out eight. John Schreiber, Sam Long, James McArthur, Kris Bubic, and Lucas Erceg made appearances in the bullpen.
